name: Classic Indian Chicken Curry
ingredients: 1.5 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in, cut into pieces
steps:
Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces, keeping the bone for extra flavor.
Heat vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
Add chopped onion and cook for 6-8 minutes until golden brown and caramelized.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add all ground spices (curry powder, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, coriander, cayenne) and stir for 30 seconds to toast the spices.
Add diced tomatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes until they break down and form a paste.
Add chicken pieces and cook for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally, until chicken is browned on all sides.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until chicken is tender and cooked through.
Stir in yogurt and lemon juice, then simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot over steamed basmati rice.
